column4: question: I have two ogg files, song.ogg and guitar.ogg, that I want to mix together to one ogg files containing them both played simultaneously; how can I do this?
try audacity
if you want to install to an encrypted drive I think so.. you could of course do all kinds of voodoo to an already installed system.. but it will be much much harder
<--- ...ibartfast? ;)
yes.. the very same.. coming up with original nicks for irc is hard..
I think flash uses what firefox uses.. and that can be set using a setting in "about:config"
what's the pref name?
I'm looking.. I configured it myself only a month or so ago.. but I've already forgotten what it was called =)
wouldn't it make sense that firefox doesn't know about sound natively, but lets plugins handle that?
ah.. it was in /etc/firefox-3.0/firefoxrc .. there is a keyword FIREFOX_DSP=
I think you can set it to padsp or aoss to use pulseaudio or alsa respectively
/etc/firefox-3.0/firefoxrc doesn't exist on my box... hmm...
nothing firefox at all in /etc for you?
/etc/firefox-3.0/pr{ef,ofile} alright, but locate firefoxrc is empty
so how do you make firefox use something else?
hmm.. I've got the pref and profile folders too.. but also this firefoxrc... hang on.. let me pastebin it for you
http://pastebin.com/f31c31501
doesn't work :(
no value of FIREFOX_DSP seems to work for me
and remove the livecd and put in the blank how?  ...
has this been solved for jaunty?
does it really need the cd once it has created the ram drive?
